meanings.sent1: The princess wore a beautiful, ringed crown.
meanings.sent2: The tree had a ringed pattern on its trunk.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked quite fancy with its ringed collar.
meanings.sent4: The sky was ringed with colors as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The ringed planet stood out in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The snake had a ringed pattern on its body.
meanings.sent2: The vase was decorated with a ringed design.
meanings.sent3: The circus tent looked festive with its ringed decorations.
meanings.sent4: The target was ringed with different colored circles.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar was easily identified by its ringed segments.

meanings.definition: To put a ring on something.
meanings.sent1: She ringed her finger with a beautiful diamond.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd ringed the sheep for identification.
meanings.sent3: He playfully ringed his friend's coffee cup with sugar packets.
meanings.sent4: The artist ringed the painting with a thin gold frame.
meanings.sent5: The explorer ringed the ancient tree to measure its age.
